text: José María "Chema" Antón Samper (born 19 March 1989 in Casas del Señor, Valencian Community, Spain) is a Spanish footballer. ==Career== Antón came to Real Madrid's youth system in 2003, when he was 14 years old. In 2007, he made his professional debut playing with Real Madrid B in the Segunda División B (3rd level of Spain's league system). Without playing in the team, he sat on the bench in Bernd Schuster's last match as coach of Real Madrid and the first of Juande Ramos. He also played 8 international matches for Spain's Under-19 team in the U19 European Cup. In 2010 he signed with Real Betis Sevilla playing one season in the second team in the Segunda División B. In 2011 he signed with FC Red Bull Salzburg in the Austrian Bundesliga. ==References== ==Other websites== *Players profile on FC Red Bull Salzburg homepage Category:Spanish footballers Category:1989 births Category:Living people Category:FC Red Bull Salzburg players Category:Austrian football champions
title: José María Antón
